item.title: Lint your markdown files with gulp‑remark‑lint‑dko

item.title: git-my
item.description: Git doesn’t track who created branches. This makes it difficult to keep track of your own branches when you have a lot of them checked out locally. To remedy this, I wrote a shell script that gets all the remote git branches and filters them out based on the last committer. It then lists the ones where you were the last committer. You can find the script here: https://github.com/davidosomething/git-my Here’s a screenshot of it in action:

item.title: Linux on the Lenovo Thinkpad W510 – Part 3
item.description: The NVidia drivers after 343.22 no longer support the NVidia Quadro FX 880M GPU for the ThinkPad W510 so I had to switch to legacy drivers (340-xx). To get everything working again, I make some changes to my kernel mode settings and my xorg.conf. In /boot/syslinux/syslinux.cfg and /etc/xorg.conf.d/20-nvidia.conf I am now using this: And in the syslinux.cfg the line DEFAULT arch is now DEFAULT archnvidia to default to the new kernel settings.
